information:
This is a rematch for the UFC bantamweight title, scheduled to headline UFC 316 on June 7-8, 2025, in Newark, New Jersey. In their first fight at UFC 306 in September 2024, Merab Dvalishvili defeated Sean O'Malley by unanimous decision to win the championship. Commentator Joe Rogan has questioned how O'Malley gets past Dvalishvili's abilities, and former champion Henry Cejudo has referred to Dvalishvili as the greatest bantamweight of all time.

Merab Dvalishvili is the current UFC bantamweight champion and is on a 12-fight winning streak. His last fight was a unanimous decision victory over Umar Nurmagomedov in January 2025, marking his first successful title defense. In the weeks leading up to the fight, Dvalishvili has reported suffering minor injuries to his finger and a toe on his right foot during training, but stated his intention to compete regardless.

Sean O'Malley is the former bantamweight champion. This fight will be his first since undergoing hip surgery in October 2024 following his loss to Dvalishvili. In preparation for the rematch, O'Malley has been sparring with former UFC middleweight champion Israel Adesanya. O'Malley has stated he is confident in his skills and expects to be significantly better than he was in the first fight post-surgery.

forecast.time_left_until_outcome_known: Approximately two weeks, as the fight is scheduled for June 7-8, 2025.
forecast.status_quo_outcome: Merab Dvalishvili defeats Sean O'Malley, likely by a dominant decision, repeating the outcome of their first fight.
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: Sean O'Malley, showing significant improvement in takedown defense and fight strategy post-surgery, keeps the fight at a distance and wins via knockout. Alternatively, Dvalishvili's reported injuries worsen, forcing him to withdraw from the UFC 316 card, which would also cause a 'No' resolution.
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: Merab Dvalishvili successfully implements his high-pressure, wrestling-heavy game plan, controlling Sean O'Malley on the ground for a significant portion of the fight to secure a victory by unanimous decision or a ground-and-pound TKO.
forecast.rationale:
My forecast is heavily weighted by the outcome of the first fight at UFC 306, where Merab Dvalishvili defeated Sean O'Malley by a dominant unanimous decision. This established a clear stylistic advantage, with Dvalishvili's relentless wrestling and cardio proving to be an unsolvable problem for O'Malley. The status quo suggests a repeat of this outcome, as Dvalishvili has since reinforced his champion status with a title defense against another elite contender, Umar Nurmagomedov, and remains on a 12-fight winning streak. Expert opinion from figures like Joe Rogan and Henry Cejudo further supports the idea that Dvalishvili's style is a nightmare matchup for O'Malley.

My forecast is not higher because of a few key variables that introduce uncertainty. First, Sean O'Malley is an elite striker with proven one-punch knockout power, and the 'puncher's chance' is always a factor. Second, O'Malley is returning from hip surgery, and he claims he will be significantly improved; this, combined with a focused training camp alongside Israel Adesanya, could lead to meaningful adjustments in his anti-wrestling game. Third, Dvalishvili has reported 'minor' injuries to his finger and toe. While he intends to compete, these could potentially hinder his performance or, in a worse-case scenario, lead to a fight cancellation, which would resolve this question as 'No'.

My forecast is not lower because the evidence for a Dvalishvili win is substantial and concrete, whereas the case for an O'Malley victory relies more on speculation about his potential improvements. Overcoming such a decisive stylistic disadvantage, as seen in the first fight, is a monumental task. The burden of proof lies with O'Malley to demonstrate that he has fundamentally evolved as a fighter in less than a year.

I would increase my probability if credible reports indicated O'Malley's training was not going well or if Dvalishvili's injuries were confirmed to be completely negligible. Conversely, I would decrease my probability if Dvalishvili's injuries worsened and a withdrawal seemed more likely, or if strong evidence emerged from O'Malley's camp of him successfully defending takedowns against elite wrestlers.

prompt:
You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.

Your interview question is:
Will Merab Dvalishvili defeat Sean O'Malley at UFC 316?

Question background:
ESPN: [UFC 316: Dvalishvili vs. O'Malley 2](https://www.espn.com/mma/fightcenter/_/id/600053672/league/ufc)


This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
This question resolves as **Yes** if Merab Dvalishvili defeats Sean O'Malley at [UFC 316](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UFC_316).

If Dvalishvili does not fight anyone at UFC 316 or fights someone else, this resolves as No.


Your research assistant's report says:
This is a rematch for the UFC bantamweight title, scheduled to headline UFC 316 on June 7-8, 2025, in Newark, New Jersey. In their first fight at UFC 306 in September 2024, Merab Dvalishvili defeated Sean O'Malley by unanimous decision to win the championship. Commentator Joe Rogan has questioned how O'Malley gets past Dvalishvili's abilities, and former champion Henry Cejudo has referred to Dvalishvili as the greatest bantamweight of all time.

Merab Dvalishvili is the current UFC bantamweight champion and is on a 12-fight winning streak. His last fight was a unanimous decision victory over Umar Nurmagomedov in January 2025, marking his first successful title defense. In the weeks leading up to the fight, Dvalishvili has reported suffering minor injuries to his finger and a toe on his right foot during training, but stated his intention to compete regardless.

Sean O'Malley is the former bantamweight champion. This fight will be his first since undergoing hip surgery in October 2024 following his loss to Dvalishvili. In preparation for the rematch, O'Malley has been sparring with former UFC middleweight champion Israel Adesanya. O'Malley has stated he is confident in his skills and expects to be significantly better than he was in the first fight post-surgery.

Today is 2025-05-26.

Before answering you think:
(a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
(b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
(c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
(d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
(e) You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time. Explain your reasoning and the evidence behind your forecast in detail. Summarise information your received from your research assistant that influences your forecast (if any). Explain why your forecast is not higher, and why it is not lower. Outline what would need to be true for you to update your forecast in either direction.
(f) The last thing you write is your final probabilistic forecast as a number between 0 and 100.

# OUTPUT SCHEMA
{
    "time_left_until_outcome_known": "string",
    "status_quo_outcome": "string",
    "no_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "yes_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "rationale": "string",
    "probability": "number" (0-100)
}
